name: Hampton Inn Oklahoma City/Yukon

reviews.text: I'm a fan of Hilton Hotels and have been impressed with most Hamptons that I have stayed in. not this one. It seems as if they remodeled the rooms on the cheap and completely forgot to remodel the hallways. Our room was dank and a roach on the ceiling greeted me upon entry. This hotel was too cheap to include a desk chair so you must sit on an ottoman that is much too low to the ground. The carpet on the far end of the room looks as if it hasn't been vacuumed since the remodel and the room smelled like a dank movie theatre. Bathrooms are tiny compared to other Hamptons. The Homewood suites down the road is nicer and a much better value, we paid 6 dollars more to stay there. I've definitely been in worse but with a lot of other options around I will not return to this hotel and would suggest for others to stay elsewhere.
reviews.title: Stay elsewhere

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We really liked our room, which appeared to be recently updated. Beds were really comfortable, the A/C worked well (but was tricky to set so that the fan stayed on continuously, something we like to cover occasional noises). Bathroom was standard Hampton size, but also seemed updated. Breakfast was extensive and pretty good, and we really like that they serve till 10 am. In room WiFi was free and easy to access, but somewhat slow. Fine for checking e-mail/basic browsing, but don't plan to watch streaming Netflix. The lap desk in the room was a nice touch!
reviews.title: Updated, comfy room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had requested a top floor, quiet location on our online booking form, and that's exactly what we got. Check in and check out were friendly and fast.
reviews.title: saved our day

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A few minor negatives: We did not get a paper (USA Today) at the door, looked like they maybe ran out just before us? I asked at the front desk and they did manage to find a copy of the Oklahoma City daily for me. Comforters were overwashed/worn out - had become lumpy (the covers were new, clean and nice). As another review mentioned, the footstool (not a work chair) at the room desk is weird/awkward. Would not have wanted to stay here on biz and need to compute or write a lot. The Zenith 27" tube TV looked really out of place in a nicely upscale/updated room. Likewise, the shower enclosure looked like a do it yourself kit from Home Depot - as compared to the granite sink counter. Sort of funny cheap/expensive mix of room features. But whatever, the overall experience was quite positive for us.
reviews.title: Clean and comfortable, but strange seating options
got the job done
reviews.text: We had planned a weekend in Bricktown with our kids over the New Year's Eve holiday. My husband had made an error in reserving our rooms in Bricktown, so we had our kids to stay there and we had to speedily find a room for the night. Bricktown was simply packed with people and there were no other rooms at any of the other hotels in Bricktown!!! I had seen the Hampton Inn in Yukon before and some of our extended family stayed there. So, we took a chance. It is clean, the beds are really comfortable, the rooms are designed nicely, it is quiet, and the price is good. So, it "saved the day," for us that weekend!! Loved it and felt that with another New Year's celebration, then we should all stay there, instead of fighting all of the traffic in Bricktown. The staff at the front desk were very nice and they had snacks on hand that evening that were free and they have an excellent continental breakfast. Everything was clean and nice. Yukon is a suberb of OKC and only five minutes away from OKC.

I've stayed in a number of Hampton Inns around the country and the state, and this is the most poorly managed one I've ever encountered. The hotel itself is older but OK, generally well kept, but it doesn't have the public spaces of newer ones and the breakfast area is particularly problematic. Rooms and cleanliness are OK, but nothing special. The front desk staff is abrupt, bordering on rude. If you're not expecting a typical Hampton and if you're willing to put up with a generally abrupt staff, it's OK. Ask for a room away from the highway. My next time in Yukon, however, I'll try the HI-E.
reviews.title: Only OK

reviews.text: Older building, but nice stay. Comfortable room, concrete floors, and an excellent breakfast. Good location, slightly outside of OK City, but several nice restaurants close by.
reviews.title: Hampton Inn Oklahoma City/Yukon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had no complaints at all about this hotel. Our room was comfortable, clean, and the entire hotel seemed to have been recently updated. We stayed only one night, but it certainly was a pleasant stay! If we go back thru the OKC area ever again, this is the place we'll choose.
reviews.title: Very nice!

reviews.text: We enjoyed our generously sized king room,...with an interestingly different floorplan. Very comfortable bed, extremely clean room and hotel common areas, friendly staff (even after our toddler daughter made a mess at breakfast), great desk/work area, and easy to find location. The breakfast selection was pleasantly surprising as well. If we need a place to stay in the area again, we'll certainly choose this hotel.
reviews.title: relaxing stay after a long day of driving

reviews.text: Lovely rooms, decent breakfast. Staff was very friendly and accommodating. I'd come back.
reviews.title: It's a nice place.

reviews.text: Something has changed here. I have been at this hotel before when traveling through Oklahoma, but perhaps time has taken its toll. Or perhaps a management change? Room not as clean or nice as before. Not up to par as at other Hampton Inns I have stayed in and when I made a comment, management insinuates everything fine. Made me feel stupid. I don't know what it is, but I will stay at one of the other hotels in the area.
reviews.title: Newer and Better Hotels in Yukon Now

reviews.text: An oasis in a busy area. Thought this would be just another interstate hotel on a busy edge of town, but was pleasantly surprised. Did not have a reservation, but it only took moments to check in. Rooms were very large. Nice indoor pool. Eating places nearby. Quiet. Quick interstate access. Breakfast area was large enough and up to Hampton Inn standards. If you are driving long distance and need a place to stay for one night, this would be a good value. Rates were less than other Hampton Inns in more rural places and the property was really modern.
reviews.title: Good Value
Disapointed
reviews.text: As usual we always read the tripadvisor reviews prior to our stay. Based on the reviews we thought this hotel would be excellent. It was not.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we arrived the hotel lobby was nicely appointed, unfortunately we do not spend the majority of our stay in the lobby.
reviews.title: Outstanding

reviews.text: Upon arriving in our room on the 3rd floor, the carpet baseboard was half ripped off and hanging on the floor. The room itself was standard with two beds and was nicely decorated.
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.text: Excellent hotel as we drive across the country to the western part of the US. Family of 4 with two middle schoolers, and this hotel was an excellent choice for a one night stay for us. Very friendly hotel staff. Nice little work out area, etc. Clean, nice sized rooms, and location. Of the six hotels we have stayed at so far on our trip, this had one of the lower end breakfast options, but it was still okay. No complaints here...feel comfortable staying here if you need a place in the OKC area.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel for Our Family of 4 Vacation Trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here on our last night of an 8 day vacation. One of the best hotels on our trip. The room was first class. Great nights sleep, fluffy pillows, comfortable bed. The bathroom vanity is not very big, but the bathroom is a good size, nice towels, clean rooms. The front desk was very helpful and friendly upon check-in and check- out. Great breakfast, first time I have seen a western omelette on a breakfast bar. Would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Great hotel, stay here on way through Ok. City

reviews.text: Wonderful property. Great beds, heated indoor pool, good breakfast, friendly staff. Would recommend and would stay here again in a flash. Thanks to the night front desk guy who helped with a restaurant that night. Can,t understand the lower ratings.
reviews.title: 4 + star

reviews.text: I'm not a frequent traveller, but I have to say this Hampton really impressed me. Arriving at near midnight, GPS wouldn't pick up the address, so I called. Staff was able to give me an address my GPS would recognize to get me close, which was a lifesaver, and four hours later when I checked out they were just as freindly and helpful.
reviews.title: Very impressed

reviews.text: Breakfast was better than expected, and better than I have seen at any other Hampton, room was impressive, overall it was a great stay and if ever in the area again I'll certainly book it for more than a few hours of sleep.
reviews.title: Great location, helpful staff and Comfortable Stay

description: The Hampton Inn Oklahoma City/Yukon is conveniently located near many of the area's top attractions and offers guests comfortable rooms featuring clean and fresh Hampton beds.
